question: A particle moves with simple harmonic motion in a straight line. In first τ s, after starting from rest it travels a distance a, and in next τ s it travels 2a, in same direction, then:
explanation: Starts from rest -> Extreme position. x = A cos(ωt). At t=0, x=A. At t=τ, x=A-a. At t=2τ, x=A-3a. A-a = A cos(ωτ). A-3a = A cos(2ωτ). cos(2ωτ) = 2cos^2(ωτ) - 1. (A-3a)/A = 2((A-a)/A)^2 - 1. 1 - 3a/A = 2(1 - a/A)^2 - 1. Let a/A = y. 1-3y = 2(1-y)^2 - 1 = 2(1-2y+y^2) - 1 = 2 - 4y + 2y^2 - 1 = 1 - 4y + 2y^2. -3y = -4y + 2y^2. y = 2y^2. 1 = 2y. y = 1/2. a/A = 1/2. A = 2a. cos(ωτ) = (2a-a)/2a = 1/2. ωτ = π/3. 2π/T * τ = π/3. T = 6τ.

question: A simple pendulum has a time period T. If the point of suspension moves upwards with velocity v = kt, where k = 1 m/s^2, the new time period will be:
